properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 7 at 3:23AM EST until February 7 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...SNOW SHOWERS TO AFFECT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE NORTH
CAROLINA MOUNTAINS ALONG THE TENNESSEE BORDER TODAY...

.Cold air will spill rapidly east across the North Carolina
mountains this morning. Moist, westerly flow arriving in the
mountains throughout the day will produce snow showers along the
higher elevations, especially along the immediate Tennessee
border. The combination of accumulating light snow, wet roads, and
temperatures falling below the freezing mark will create slippery
conditions.

* WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, with a few of
the highest ridge tops seeing 4 inches.

* WHERE...Elevations above 3500 feet in the Tennessee border
counties of western North Carolina.

* WHEN...Until 6 PM EST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions as the snow
accumulates and wet roads freeze as temperatures dip below the
freezing mark. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning
and evening commutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution if traveling in the mountains today.

Please report snow and ice accumulations by calling the National
Weather Service toll free at...1...800...2 6 7...8 1 0 1. Leave a
message with your observation and the specific location where it
occurred. You can also post your report to National Weather
Service Greenville Spartanburg Facebook or tweet your report
using hashtag nwsgsp.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your favorite source of
weather information for the latest updates. Additional details
can be found at www.weather.gov/gsp.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING ABOVE 3500 FEET
